snippet: Sean Thomas was awarded $450,000 in damages after he sued three police officers, but his main witness signed an agreement promising to testify in exchange for cash.
abstract: Judge Andrew L Carter Jr throws out verdict that awarded Sean Thomas $450,000 in damages in his lawsuit against New York City police officers for using excessive force against him;  authorities discover that Thomas's main witness in case, his girlfriend Letitia Marrow, had  signed an agreement promising to testify on his behalf in exchange for cash; New York law prohibits paying a witness in exchange for favorable testimony.
lead_paragraph: Sean Thomas was awarded $450,000 in damages after he sued three police officers, but his main witness signed an agreement promising to testify in exchange for cash.

headline.seo: Verdict Finding Excessive Force by Police Is Thrown Out
headline.main: Judge Throws Out Verdict in Police Brutality Case
headline.print_headline: Judge Throws Out Verdict In Police Brutality Case
